title: How to Unlock a Globe Lock

steps.title: Check that your phone qualifies for unlocking.
steps.content: Check that your phone qualifies for unlocking. Log onto your Globe account and see if you owe any payments for your current contract. If you have a prepaid phone, you’ll just need the IMEI number of your prepaid Globe handset as well as your current Globe phone number. [1] X Research source If you’d like to unlock your phone before your original contract ends, you’ll need to pay extra fees. You know a phone is prepaid if you purchased it as part of a prepaid phone kit from Globe.

steps.title: Dial Globe’s main hotline at (02) 730-1288 to request the unlocking.
steps.content: Dial Globe’s main hotline at (02) 730-1288 to request the unlocking. Call Globe’s general business hotline at (02) 730-1288, where you can submit an official request for the company to unlock your phone. You can also submit a request via email to enterprisesupport@globe.com.ph. [2] X Research source For instance, you can say something like: “Hello! I’m looking to change carriers on my phone and would like to unlock my device.”

steps.title: Wait 5 days for Globe to process your request.
steps.content: Wait 5 days for Globe to process your request. Keep in mind that Globe is a big company, and they won’t be able to unlock your phone instantaneously. Give them around 5 business days to unlock your phone so you can switch to a different carrier. Wait until you have verbal or digital confirmation from Globe before you tinker around with your unlocked phone. [3] X Research source A customer service agent will likely give you an estimate of when your phone will be unlocked and ready to go. If you aren’t sure if your phone is unlocked, call Globe at (02) 7730-1000.

steps.title: Turn off the touch ID function in your phone.
steps.content: Turn off the touch ID function in your phone. Go into your phone’s settings and toggle off any fingerprint recognition. Once your phone is unlocked, you can reset your fingerprint lock. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Shut off your phone completely.
steps.content: Shut off your phone completely. Check that your phone is totally powered down, and not just in sleep mode. Tap on your phone and press some of the buttons to make sure nothing lights up. [5] X Research source Since you’re adding a new SIM card, your phone needs to be completely off.

steps.title: Insert a new SIM card into your phone.
steps.content: Insert a new SIM card into your phone. Find where your SIM card is stored in your phone and remove it completely. Take your new SIM card and secure it in the cartridge. Double-check that the card is in the correct position, or your phone won’t work properly. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Plug your phone into your computer or laptop.
steps.content: Plug your phone into your computer or laptop. Wait for your phone to light up after connecting to a computer. Since your phone is unlocked now, you’ll see a welcome screen on your phone. [7] X Research source This process will be similar to when you set up your phone for the first time. Your phone will turn on automatically after you plug it into a computer or laptop.

steps.title: Follow the prompts to activate your phone.
steps.content: Follow the prompts to activate your phone. Go through the different steps on your screen, like selecting a language. Eventually, look for a pop-up that mentions activating your phone. If your phone doesn’t activate correctly the first time, hit the “try again” button to re-activate your phone with your new network. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Bend a paperclip so 1 section is at a 45-degree angle.
steps.content: Bend a paperclip so 1 section is at a 45-degree angle. Take an ordinary paperclip and pinch the outer end of the clip. Pull this end of the clip outwards so it creates a 45-degree angle. Don’t stretch the paperclip out all the way—this section will be used to press and pick the individual pins inside of your Globe lock. [9] X Research source Any type of padlock, including a Globe lock, is held in place by several thin, horizontal sections of metal known as pins. These pins naturally sit at different lengths and are all pushed in simultaneously when you use the key, which allows your lock to open.

steps.title: Unfold and bend another paperclip in half so you can pick the lock more easily.
steps.content: Unfold and bend another paperclip in half so you can pick the lock more easily. Take a second paperclip and unfold it completely, creating a long, thin line of metal. Fold this long section of metal in half, creating a rounded end. As a finishing touch, bend the rounded end of the paperclip at a 90-degree angle so it’ll fit comfortably in the lock. [10] X Research source Try to fold the paperclip in half as thin as you can so it’s easier to work with. This section of the paperclip will help apply pressure to the lock while you pick it, which will make it easier for you to focus on the pins.

steps.title: Press the folded paperclip along the thickest opening of the lock.
steps.content: Press the folded paperclip along the thickest opening of the lock. Hold the Globe lock upside down and look for the keyhole. Note that the left side of the keyhole is thicker, while the right side begins to taper off. As you start picking, press the curved end of the paperclip into the left, wider opening of the keyhole. Apply pressure to this paperclip so the lock is a bit easier to pick. [12] X Research source This paperclip helps provide tension, and makes it easier for you to adjust the pins in the padlock.

steps.title: Rake the straight section of the paperclip against the right lock opening.
steps.content: Rake the straight section of the paperclip against the right lock opening. Take the paperclip bent at a 45-degree angle and stick the pointy end into the lock. Push the paperclip as far in as you can, then drag the pointed section quickly along the right side of the lock. You’ll hear a slight rattle or click as you rake the paperclip over the pins, which means you’re on the right track. [13] X Research source You won’t open the Globe lock instantly—instead, raking the pins adds a slow, steady pressure that will eventually force the pins up and allow your device to unlock. Continue applying pressure with the other paperclip as you do this.

steps.title: Repeat the raking process around 10 times.
steps.content: Repeat the raking process around 10 times. Stick the pointed end of the paperclip into the lock again, dragging it along the pins. Keep raking the pins over and over again until you’re confident that all the pins are pushed up. [14] X Research source There’s no exact formula to raking a lock. It take a lot of trial and error before you get the process down, so don’t give up!

steps.title: Turn the folded paperclip clockwise slightly to open the lock.
steps.content: Turn the folded paperclip clockwise slightly to open the lock. Pull the pointed paperclip out of the lock while keeping the rounded, folded clip in place. Rotate the rounded paperclip slightly to pop the Globe lock open. Once you’re ready to go, click the thick, rounded section of the lock back into place again. [15] X Research source
